recommendations.title: Secure 3-Year Deal with 15% Discount & Enhanced SLA Package
recommendations.description: Propose a 3-year contract extension at $4.01M total value ($1.337M annually) with enhanced enterprise support, priority feature access, and dedicated CSM. Lock in revenue while providing BT with cost savings and premium service guarantees.
recommendations.reasoning: BT's 95.2% retention rate and 81/100 health score indicate strong satisfaction and low churn risk. As a major telecom requiring long-term infrastructure planning, BT values predictable costs and premium support. The 4.8% annual discount justifies their 3-year commitment while securing our revenue.
specificActions: Week 1: Schedule C-level meeting with BT's IT Director and Procurement lead to present 3-year proposal with ROI analysis showing $210K savings vs annual renewals
Week 2: Prepare enhanced SLA package including 99.9% uptime guarantee, 4-hour response time, and quarterly business reviews with dedicated Technical Account Manager
Week 3: Create custom contract terms including annual price protection (no increases), priority access to new CloudSense modules, and flexible usage scaling up to 25%
Week 4: Present final proposal with implementation timeline and dedicated onboarding for any new features included in enhanced package
Week 6: Target contract signature with effective date aligned to current renewal cycle
risks: BT procurement may push for deeper discounts beyond 15%
Internal approval processes at BT could extend timeline past renewal date
successFactors: Emphasize cost predictability and budget planning benefits for BT's 3-year IT strategy
Highlight enhanced SLA value proposition given BT's critical infrastructure needs
Leverage existing strong relationship and high satisfaction scores as proof of partnership value

recommendations.title: 2-Year Early Renewal + Premium Upgrade Package
recommendations.description: Propose immediate 2-year contract renewal with upgrade to Premium Annual plan, offering 15% early renewal discount and additional premium features. Target signing within 15 days to secure expanded commitment before current contract expires.
recommendations.reasoning: With 90.4% retention rate and strong 82 health score, WHOLESALE CARRIER SERVICES shows high satisfaction and low churn risk. As a wholesale carrier, they likely need enhanced reliability and scalability features that Premium offers, making the upgrade valuable for their business growth.
specificActions: Day 1-2: Account Manager schedules renewal discussion call with decision maker to present 2-year Premium upgrade proposal
Day 3-7: Prepare customized ROI analysis showing cost savings of 2-year commitment vs annual renewals plus Premium feature value
Day 8-12: Present formal proposal: 2-year Premium contract at $165,000 total ($82,500/year) with 15% early renewal discount
Day 13-15: Negotiate final terms and secure signature with expedited legal review process
Day 16-30: Implement Premium features and conduct success check-in calls
risks: Customer may prefer to stick with current Basic plan to control costs
30-day timeline may create pressure that backfires in negotiations
successFactors: Strong health score (82) indicates customer satisfaction with current service
High retention rate (90.4%) suggests low churn risk for longer commitment
Wholesale carrier business model likely benefits from Premium scalability features

recommendations.title: Early 3-Year Renewal with 25% Uplift & Multi-Product Expansion
recommendations.description: Leverage COMPORIUM's excellent health score (91) and perfect retention (100.5%) to secure an early 3-year renewal at $91,380 ARR with additional Kandy products. Position this as a strategic partnership investment with locked-in pricing protection against future increases.
recommendations.reasoning: With 30 days to renewal and exceptional performance metrics, COMPORIUM is in an ideal position for expansion. Their 100.5% retention rate indicates they're likely underutilizing current capacity and could benefit from additional Kandy communication features. The timing creates urgency while their high satisfaction reduces price sensitivity.
specificActions: Day 1-3: CSM conducts usage analysis to identify 2-3 underutilized Kandy features that align with COMPORIUM's communication needs
Day 4-7: Account Manager schedules C-level meeting to present 3-year strategic partnership proposal with 15% early renewal discount plus 25% capacity increase
Day 8-14: Demo advanced Kandy features (video conferencing, advanced analytics) showing ROI projections specific to COMPORIUM's telecom business
Day 15-21: Present final proposal: 3-year contract at $91,380 ARR (25% increase) with price lock guarantee and premium support tier
Day 22-30: Negotiate final terms and secure signature before current contract expires
risks: Customer may prefer shorter contract terms due to budget cycles
Competition might emerge during extended negotiation period
successFactors: High health score demonstrates strong product-market fit
Perfect retention rate indicates expansion readiness
30-day renewal window creates natural urgency for decision-making

recommendations.title: 18-Month Early Renewal + Multi-Year Lock-in Strategy
recommendations.description: Propose an immediate 18-month early renewal with 15% ARR increase to $83,640, followed by a 3-year contract at current pricing to secure long-term retention. This leverages the customer's excellent health score and current satisfaction while creating urgency around pricing protection.
recommendations.reasoning: With a 88/100 health score and 100.1% retention rate, NUWAVE is clearly satisfied and likely to renew. Their single-product usage suggests untapped potential, and the 30-day renewal window creates perfect timing to negotiate from a position of mutual benefit rather than desperation.
specificActions: Week 1: CSM schedules strategic business review with NUWAVE's IT leadership to discuss 2024-2025 communication roadmap and identify expansion needs
Week 2: Account Manager presents early renewal proposal: 18-month extension at $83,640 ARR (15% increase) with guaranteed rate lock for subsequent 3-year term
Week 3: Offer additional Kandy product demo/trial as sweetener for early commitment, targeting their single-product limitation
Week 4: Negotiate final terms with decision maker, emphasizing cost predictability and avoiding 2025 price increases
Week 5: Execute contract signing with legal teams and process early renewal documentation
risks: Customer may resist 15% increase despite value proposition
Early renewal timing might conflict with their budget cycle planning
successFactors: Leverage their high satisfaction score as proof of value received
Position rate lock as protection against future market increases
Use single-product status to show growth runway and justify investment

recommendations.title: 3-Year Early Renewal with 15% Uplift + Multi-Product Bundle
recommendations.description: Negotiate a 3-year early renewal with 15% annual increase plus introduce complementary Kandy products to create a comprehensive communications platform bundle. Leverage the high health score and strong retention rate to secure multi-year commitment with growth.
recommendations.reasoning: With 88/100 health score and 96.6% retention rate, YADKIN VALLEY shows strong product satisfaction and loyalty. As a telecommunications membership cooperative, they likely value long-term partnerships and cost predictability that a multi-year deal provides, while the 30-day renewal window creates urgency for negotiation.
specificActions: Week 1: Schedule executive-level meeting with YADKIN VALLEY leadership to present 3-year strategic partnership proposal with 15% annual growth ($57,047 Year 1 ARR)
Week 2: Conduct technical demo of 2-3 complementary Kandy products that enhance their current solution, targeting $15K-25K additional ARR
Week 3: Present bundled pricing proposal: 3-year deal at $165K total contract value (vs. current $149K over 3 years) with locked-in rates and additional product credits
Week 4: Finalize contract terms with early renewal incentives: 5% discount on additional products if signed 2 weeks before current expiration
Week 5: Execute contract signing and initiate expanded product implementation plan
risks: Customer may prefer annual flexibility over multi-year commitment
Budget constraints for additional products in current fiscal year
successFactors: Emphasize cost savings and rate protection over 3-year term
Demonstrate clear ROI on additional Kandy products for telecom operations
Leverage existing strong relationship and high satisfaction scores

recommendations.title: 18-Month Early Renewal + Multi-Year Discount Strategy
